attributes.action: stop producing carrier bags within the uk.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Worldwide we use about a trillion carrier bags each year which weigh approximately 50m tonnes and require 50m barrels of oil in their manufacture. If thats not bad enought, the majority of the bags imported into the UK are from Malaysia, China and Thailand, meaning thousands of more transport miles powered by fossil fuels.

It appears that 1 in 200 are used as bin liners or for wrapping waste, but means the other 199 go straight in the bin, they still go to landfill and take 1000 years to degrade.

Bangladesh was the first country to ban them despite the opposition of the local twenty six plastic bag manufacturers, and other countries have banned them, or imposed a tax. So why arn't we doing anything?

Even though degradable carrier bags are currently being introduced in many supermarkets, they still require sunlight which is in short supply in landfill, so they are still there for the next 1000 years.
